I refuse to submit to such an indignity ! She owes nothing to anybody . My wife is not making visits in this town . You say you believe me , governor ? That 's enough for me ! Here 's my resignation ! I 'll go out and look for another job !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: No , no , Ponza , I must speak plainly . In the first place I have always treated you on the square ; and you have no right to speak in that tone of voice to me . In the second place you are beginning to make me doubt your word by refusing to furnish me — not other people — but me , the evidence that I have asked for in your interest , evidence , moreover , that so far as I can see , cannot possibly do you any harm . It seems to me that my colleague here , Signor Agazzi , can ask a lady to come to his house ! But no , if you prefer , we 'll go and see her .

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: So you really insist , governor ?

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: I insist , but as I told you , in your own interest . You realize , besides , that I might have the legal right to question her ....

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: I see , I see ! So that 's it ! An official investigation ! Well , why not , after all ? I will bring my wife here , just to end the whole matter . But how can you guarantee me that this poor old lady next door will not catch sight of her ?

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Why , I had n't thought of that ! She does live right next door . AGAZZIspeaking upWe are perfectly willing to go to Signor Ponza 's house .

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: No , no , I was just thinking of you people . I do n't want you to play any more tricks on me . Any mistakes might have the most frightful consequences , set her going again !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: You 're not very fair to us , Ponza , it seems to me .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Or you might bring your wife to my office , rather ....

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: No , no ! Since you 're going to question her anyway , we might as well get through with it . We 'll bring her here , right here . I 'll keep an eye on my mother-in-law myself . We 'll have her here right away , governor , and get an end of this nonsense once and for all , once and for all !He hurries away through the rear exit .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: I confess I was not expecting so much opposition on his part .

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Ah , you 'll see . He 'll go and cook up with his wife just what she 's to say !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Oh , do n't worry as to that ! I 'll question the woman myself .

sp.speaker: SIRELLI
sp.p: But he 's more excited than he 's ever been before .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Well , I confess I never saw him just in this state of mind . Perhaps it is the sense of outrage he feels in having to bring his wife .... SIRELLI , In having to let her loose for once , you ought to say !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: A man is n't necessarily crazy because he wants to keep an eye on his wife .

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Of course he says it 's to protect her from the mother-in-law .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: I was n't thinking of just that — he may be jealous of the woman !

sp.speaker: SIRELLI
sp.p: Jealous to the extent of refusing her a servant ? For you know , do n't you , he makes his wife do all the housework ?

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: And he does all the marketing himself every morning .

sp.speaker: COMMISSIONER
sp.p: That 's right , governor ! I 've had him shadowed . An errand boy from the market carries the stuff as far as the door .

sp.speaker: SIRELLI
sp.p: But he never lets the boy inside .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Dear me , dear me ! He excused himself for that servant business when I took the matter up with him .

sp.speaker: LAUDISI
sp.p: And that 's information right from the source !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: He says he does it to save money .

sp.speaker: LAUDISI
sp.p: He has to keep two establishments on one salary .

sp.speaker: SIRELLI
sp.p: Oh , we were n't criticising how he runs his house ; but I ask you as a matter of common sense : he is a man of some position , and do you think that this second wife of his , as he calls her , who ought to be a lady , would consent to do all the work about the house ?...

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: The hardest and most disagreeable work , you understand ....

sp.speaker: SIRELLI
sp.p: just out of consideration for the mother of her husband 's first wife ?

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Oh , I say , governor , be honest now ! That does n't seem probable , does it ?

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: I confess it does seem queer ....

sp.speaker: LAUDISI
sp.p: in case this second woman is an ordinary woman !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Yes , but let 's be frank . It does n't seem reasonable . But yet , one might say — well , you could explain it as generosity on her part , and even better , as jealousy on his part . Lunatic or no lunatic , there is no denying that he 's jealous !

div.stage: A confused clamor of voices is heard from the next door ) .

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: My , I wonder what 's going on in there !

div.stage: Amalia enters from the door on the left in a state of great excitement ) .

sp.speaker: AMALIA
sp.p: Signora Frola is here !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Impossible ! How in the world did she get in ? Who sent for her ?

sp.speaker: AMALIA
sp.p: Nobody ! She came of her own accord !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Oh , no , please — just a moment ! No ! Send her away , madam , please !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: We 've got to get rid of her . Do n't let her in here ! We must absolutely keep her out !

div.stage: Signora Frola appears at the door on the left , trembling , beseeching , weeping , a handkerchief in her hand . The people in the next room are crowding around behind her ) .

lg.l: Oh , please , please ! You tell them , Signor
Agazzi ! Do n't let them send me away !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: But you must go away , madam ! We simply can n't allow you to be here now ! SIGNORA FROLAdesperatelyWhy ? Why ?Turning to AmaliaI appeal to you , Signora Agazzi .

sp.speaker: AMALIA
sp.p: But do n't you see ? The prefect is there ! They 're having an important meeting .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Oh , the prefect ! Please , governor , please ! I was intending to go and see you .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: No , I am so sorry , madam . I can n't see you just now ! You must go away !

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Yes , I am going away . I am going to leave town this very day ! I am going to leave town and never come back again !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Oh , we did n't mean that , my dear Signora Frola . We meant that we could n't see you here , just now , in this room . Do me a favor , please ! You can see the governor by and by .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: But why ? I do n't understand ! What 's happened !

sp.speaker: AGAZZI
sp.p: Why , your son-in-law will soon be here ! There , now do you see ?

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Oh , he 's coming here ? Oh , yes , in that case .... Yes , yes , ... I 'll go ! But there was something I wanted to say to you people . You must stop all this . You must let us alone . You think you are helping me . You are trying to do me a favor ; but really , what you 're doing is working me a great wrong . I 've got to leave town this very day because he must not be aroused . What do you want of him anyway ? What are you trying to do to him ? Why are you having him come here ? Oh , Mr . Governor ....

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Come , Signora Frola , do n't worry , do n't worry . I 'll see you by and by and explain everything . You just step out now , wo n't you ?

sp.speaker: AMALIA
sp.p: Please , Signora Frola ... yes , that 's right ! Come with me !

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Oh , my dear Signora Agazzi , you are trying to rob me of the one comfort I had in life , the chance of seeing my daughter once in a while , at least from a distance !She begins to weep

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: What in the world are you thinking of ? We are not asking you to leave town . We just want you to leave this room , for the time being . There , now do you understand ?

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: But it 's on his account , governor ... it 's on his account I was coming to ask you to help him ! It was on his account , not on mine !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: There , there , everything will be all right . We 'll take care of him . And we 'll have this whole business settled in a jiffy .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: But how ... how can I be sure ? I can see that everybody here hates him . They are trying to do something to him .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: No , no , not at all ! And even if they were , I would look after him . There , there , do n't worry , do n't worry !

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Oh , so you believe him ? Oh , thank you ; thank you , sir ! That means that at least you understand !

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Yes , yes , madam , I understand , I understand ! And I cautioned all these people here . It 's a misfortune that came to him long , long ago . He 's all right now ! He 's all right now !

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Only he must not go back to all those things .

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: You 're right , you 're quite right , Signora Frola , but as I told you , I understand !

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Yes , governor , that 's it ! If he compels us to live this way — well , what does it matter . That does n't do anybody any harm so long as we 're satisfied , and my daughter is happy this way . That 's enough for me , and for her ! But you 'll look after us , governor . They must n't spoil anything . Otherwise there 's nothing left for , me except to leave town and never see her again — never , not even from a distance . You must not irritate him . You must leave him alone . Oh , please !

div.stage: At this moment a wave of surprise , anxiety , dismay , sweeps over the company . Everybody falls silent and turns to the door . Suppressed exclamations are audible .

sp.speaker: VOICES
sp.p: Oh ! Oh ! Look ! There she is ! Oh ! Oh ! SIGNORA FROLAnoticing the change in people , and groaning , all of a trembleWhat 's the matter ? What 's the matter ?The company divides to either hand . A lady has appeared at the door in back . She is dressed in deep mourning and her face is concealed with a thick , black , impenetrable veilSIGNORA FROLAuttering a piercing shriek of joyOh , Lena ! Lena ! Lena ! Lena !

div.stage: She dashes forward and throws her arms about the veiled woman with the passionate hysteria of a mother who has not embraced her daughter for years and years . But at the same time from beyond the door in the rear another piercing cry comes . Ponza dashes into the room ) .

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: No ! Julia ! Julia ! Julia !

div.stage: At his voice Signora Ponza draws up stiffly in the arms of Signora Frola who is clasping her tightly . Ponza notices that his mother-in-law is thus desperately entwined about his wife and he shrieks desperately ) .

sp.speaker: PONZA
sp.p: Cowards ! Liars ! I knew you would ! I knew you would ! It is just like the lot of you ! SIGNORA PONZAturning her veiled head with a certain austere solemnity toward her husbandNever mind ! Do n't be afraid ! Just take her away , just take her away ! Please go away , now , both of you ! Please go away !

div.stage: Signora Frola , at these words , turns to her son-in-law and humbly , tremblingly , goes over and embraces him ) .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: Yes , yes , you poor boy , come with me , come with me !

div.stage: Their arms about each other 's waists , and holding each other up affectionately , Ponza and his mother-in-law withdraw through the rear door . They are both weeping . Profound silence in the company . All those present stand there with their eyes fixed upon the departing couple . As Signora Frola and Ponza are lost from view , all eyes turn expectantly upon the veiled lady . Some of the women are weeping ) .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA PONZA
sp.p: And what can you want of me now , after all this , ladies and gentlemen ? In our lives , as you see , there is something which must remain concealed . Otherwise the remedy which our love for each other has found cannot avail . PREFECTwith tears in his eyesWe surely are anxious to respect your sorrow , madam , but we must know , and we want you to tell ....

sp.speaker: SIGNORA PONZA
sp.p: What ? The truth ? The truth is simply this . I am the daughter of Signora Frola , and I am the second wife of Signor Ponza . Yes , and — for myself , I am nobody , I am nobody ....

sp.speaker: PREFECT
sp.p: Ah , but no , madam , for yourself ... you must be ... either the one or the other .

sp.speaker: SIGNORA PONZA
sp.p: Not at all , not at all , sir ! No , for myself I am ... whoever you choose to have me .Without removing her veil , she proudly casts a sweeping glance around at the company , and withdraws . They all stand looking after her . Profound silence on the stage

sp.speaker: LAUDISI
sp.p: Well , and there , my friends , you have the truth ! But are you satisfied ? Hah ! hah ! hah ! hah ! hah ! hah ! hah ! Curtain . NOTE TO “ RIGHT YOU ARE ! ” A slight adaptation has been introduced into Signora Frola 's explanation of her son-in-law 's mania , Act I , p. 184 , beginning “ No , look , look , not that ... etc . ” The Italian text reads :

sp.speaker: SIGNORA FROLA
sp.p: No guardino ... guardino .... Non e neanche lui !... Mi lascino dire . Lo hanno veduto-e cosi forte di complessione ... violento .... Sposando , fu preso da una vera frenesia d'amore .... Rischio di distruggere , quasi , la mia figliuola , ch'era delicatina ... Per consiglio dei medici e di tutti i parenti anche dei suoiche ora poverini non ci sono piu— gli si dovette sottrarre la moglie di nascosto , per chiuderla in una casa di salute ... ecc . ” A. L .
